channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Interplay Between Cap Rates and Interest Rates
item.description: What is the relationship between cap rates and interest rates? It's not as straightforward as you may think.

item.title: Online passport renewal is back for eligible applicants.
item.description: Online passport renewal is back for eligible applicants.

item.title: Still Misperceived? A Fresh Look at Bitcoin Volatility
item.description: Is Bitcoin considerably more volatile than other asset classes? It's important to approach this question analytically and with an open mind because perceptions do not always match reality.

item.title: For a South Korean instant noodle brand a first-of-its-kind product recall. Too spicy for Europeans
item.description: A Danish food regulator pulled three varieties of ramen because the spice levels posed a threat to “children and weak or elderly people.”

item.title: FX Bubbles: Through the Lens of Shiller and Sornette
item.description: The theories and models introduced by Robert Shiller and Didier Sornette are as applicable to the foreign exchange market as they are to the stock market.

item.title: Commercial real estate bargain hunters are snagging offices for ‘extreme’ discounts up to 70%
item.description: “Office is clearly in the worst shape versus the other property types,” one executive says.

item.title: Book Review: A Wealth of Well-Being
item.description: Finance practitioners can benefit from Meir Statman's challenge to make finance an “afterthought” and spend more time thinking about life well-being.

item.title: Why a ‘heartland visa’ for skilled workers could be the answer to America's immigration debate
item.description: It would make it easier for immigrants to obtain residency if they spend 6 years in parts of the U.S. that once enjoyed prosperity but now lag behind.

item.title: What’s Your Client’s Optimal Equity Allocation?
item.description: Note to investment advisors: You may be overestimating the risks of equities for conservative investors with longer investment horizons.

item.title: Who’s smarter, tech bros or bankers? The finals of a global corporate chess tournament will decide this question once and for all and crown 'the smartest company in the world'
item.description: Employees from companies like Google and Deutsche Bank will square off at the tournament this weekend.
